question: How should tables adapt when displayed on mobile devices with limited screen width?
context:
From User Story 4 - Access Tables on Different Devices:
> "**Given** a table viewed on a mobile device, **When** the screen width is limited, **Then** the table adapts to maintain readability [NEEDS CLARIFICATION: responsive behavior - horizontal scroll, column stacking, or column hiding?]"
answer_options:
| Option | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| A | Enable horizontal scrolling | Tables maintain structure but require sideways scrolling; simpler to implement, preserves all data visibility at once |
| B | Stack columns vertically | Each row becomes a card-like layout; better for very narrow screens, may require more scrolling but no horizontal movement |
| C | Hide non-essential columns with expand option | Priority columns shown by default with ability to reveal others; requires defining column priority, most complex but best UX for dense tables |
| Custom | Provide your own answer | Please describe your preferred responsive behavior |
